author: potuz
content: There was link today in the <#595701319793377299> call that reminded me of this post. When you first posted here I looked seriously into this and it seemed straightforward how to write a codec to translate to DAG-CBOR. I was interested cause I have my own ssz prototype library to test, and eth2 types are manageable and small, looking for a reasonable p2p way (even bittorrent would do) to distribute it is fine since they are finalized anyway.  But then later I found out a ton of dead projects that had claimed to do this. Or to be in the process of doing this, like this one and the projects linked there <https://github.com/ipfs/go-ipld-eth-import>. Is there any deeper problem that I'm not seeing here in the surface? Perhaps something with the protocol itself? I don't think of this as an option to the portal network, rather like a "convenience" service to have a faster way to download a close state to start syncing

author: nasdf
content:
I haven't hit any roadblocks with the IPLD codecs yet.  I think the dead projects are due to how fast things are changing.  
IPLD had a complete redesign recently to make it more efficient for the Filecoin network and also in anticipation of the Filecoin Virtual Machine.  
I also think previous projects were missing a good architecture and design, like we have now with the Portal Network specs.
